Property: safe as houses?: The Chinese economy has a long history of proving its doubters wrong. But many experts are wondering whether this time the doubters might be on to something. Beijing's goal for 2016 is to keep growth ticking over at around 6.5 per cent but four issues, like horsemen of an economic apocalypse, threaten those plans: sky-high property inventories, industrial overcapacity, heavy business taxes, and financial risks.
